doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: R. M. B. G. Heenbanda Vs. Commissioner of Co-operative Development & Registrar (Central Province) and Two Others before K. M. S. DISSANAYAKE, J
latest_doc_d.parties: R. M. B. G. Heenbanda Vs. Commissioner of Co-operative Development & Registrar (Central Province) and Two Others
latest_doc_d.keywords: Appeal-Vires of Rule 49(xii)(a) of the Co-operative Societies Regulations 1973 read in conjunction with section 72(2) of the Central Province Co-operative Societies Statute of No. 10 of 1990 as amended-Definition of ratio decidendi and obiter dicta- Distinction between obiter dicta and judicial dicta-Legal effect of ratio decidendi, obiter dicta and judicial dicta-Doctrine of Approbation and Reprobation.
latest_doc_d.legistation: Constitution - Article 138 and 154P(6)-section 11 of the High Court of the Provinces (Special Provisions) Act No. 19 of 1990-Rule 49(xii)(a) of the Co-operative Societies Regulations 1973 read in conjunction with section 72(2) of the Central Province Co-operative Societies Statute of No. 10 of 1990 as amended.
